|Title=Knowing the nutritional needs of adult athletes
|Description=Know that most sporting activities simply require an increase in energy intake.

Carbohydrates are the main substrate for high-intensity physical activity.

Lipids are the substrate for moderate and prolonged physical activity.


For the majority of sportspeople, the recommended nutritional intake is that of the general population.


For more than 3 hours of sporting activity per week, nutritional intake should be adapted by increasing energy intake to cover total energy expenditure (TEE).

properties.question: For athletes engaging in more than 3 hours of sporting activity per week, how should their nutritional intake be adjusted?
properties.option_a: Maintain the same nutritional intake as the general population.
properties.option_b: Decrease energy intake to prevent weight gain.
properties.option_c: Increase energy intake to cover total energy expenditure (TEE).
properties.option_d: Follow a strict low-carbohydrate diet to enhance performance.
